intro: Dipsacus xinjiangensis, commonly known as the Xinjiang teasel, is a flowering plant native to central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spiny, leafy stems and composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are alternate and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in clusters. Dipsacus xinjiangensis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
